author: Staff Reporter
text:
Government employees continue with their waiting agitation they have launched in RDO’s office campus here, for the second day on Friday.

The employees who started their indefinite strike on February 10 and launched serial road roko agitations for four days changed their tactic on Thursday. Though they attempted to start ‘waiting agitation’ in collectorate on Thursday, as the police security was beefed up in the campus they changed the venue. They forced their way into RDO’s office and launched their waiting agitation, a form of protest in which the protesters would stay put in a office complex seamlessly till their demands are met or they are convinced by authorities.

They started cooking their food there itself. Arranged public address system and hoarding about their strike. They were there through the Thursday’s night. Chief Minister’s announcements in assembly under rule 110 on some of their demands failed to inspire them.

The protesters said that their main demands including scrapping of the new pension scheme remain unaddressed.
title: Govt. staff continue ‘waiting agitation’
